reviews.text: We were very happy with our stay at this hotel and would definitely stay there again. It was clean, the staff was great, and the express check-out was really nice.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

likes.liked: — It was very clean and a good value.

reviews.text: We arrived at the Sheraton Music City for a weekend stay and were impressed with the level of service and cleanliness that we experienced. The beds were perfect, not too soft and not too hard, and the room was spotless. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, there seemed to be a wide variety of people staying there (i.e. families, couples, large groups, etc.). We will definitely be staying here again if we ever make it back to Nashville.
reviews.title: One of the Best Hotels I've Stayed In!
outstanding
reviews.text: I stayed at the Sheraton Music City in March 2005 for business travel. The mark of a good hotel, at least in my expierence, is how the staff reacts to a problem. After I had checked in, I was startled at a knock at the door and the sound of someone tring to enter the room. I called the front desk and they explained that another guest had misread their room number and tried to enter my room, thinking it was theirs. Without asking, they took care of my incidental charges and offered a credit on my room. The accomidations were immaculate, the beds were unbelieveable, and the bar area was run as efficiently and as pleasently as any i've ever stayed at. I normally don't write reviews, (I live in hotels and that would be a hobby that would take a considerable amount of time) but I had to brag on this propertiy. The staff were excellent, catering to my every whim. I extended my stay an extra night (because of the wonderful service) and invited my wife to Nashville (We live only two hours away) and they got me ticekts to a local hockey game (Nashville Predators, very fun) and arranged for limo service to and from. I will be in Nashville soon on pleasure and will stay no where, but the Sheraton Music City. They have been ranked the number one hotel in Nashville for 5 out of the last 6 years and I can tell why!

reviews.title: What a wonderful weekend!
reviews.text: If your looking for a place in Nashville to getaway for the weekend, this is it.

reviews.title: Could have been excellent except
reviews.text: The hotel is absolutely beautiful interior and exterior. We were greeted at the desk

reviews.title: They gave our reserved room away and put us in a room w/ a Murphy Bed!!!
reviews.text: We had a terrible experience at Sheraton Music City!!! For our fourth anniversary my wife and I decided we deserved a weekend getaway and settled on Nashville, TN. We wanted peace and quiet in a wonderful Sheraton room with a Sweet Sleeper Bed. Having previously enjoyed the Sheraton in downtown Nashville I thought a change of pace would be nice and ventured to this site looking for reviews for the Sheraton Music City. Oh, what wonderful reviews there are on this site... I am envious of everyone who had a great stay… MY EXPERIENCE SUCKED!!! We called the hotel to reconfirm our reservation while en route to the hotel and were told by the front desk that they DID indeed have our room ready for our arrival. We only live about two hours away from Nashville in Huntsville, AL. We were assured that a room on the club level with a King sized Sweet Sleeper Bed was waiting for us and although we would arrive a little later than 8pm it didn’t matter because we had RESERVED the room. When we arrived (sigh) we were given the wrong room… a double bedroom on a non-club level floor. We paid extra for a club level room. We called Sheraton Worldwide Reservation and were told that yes we should be on the club level with a KING bed and that she could see that the hotel had changed the reservation in the database at 1pm!!! How was this?!?!?! We had confirmed with them at 6:15pm. Arrrgghhh!!!! No problem… right?!?!?! We’ll just call the front desk and have our room changed… I’m sure it was just an honest mistake, right? WRONG!!! They had given our room away because of some high school basketball tournament!!! They were sooo sorry!!! But if we didn’t want to stay in a double room (of course we didn’t… it’s our anniversary) they did have a suite on the first floor by the pool?!?!?! Reluctantly, we agreed to stay in the other room and were given two free dinner coupons, whoop-dee-doo!!! But when after we trekked to the other room… luggage in tow, we found it to house a bed that YOU PULL DOWN FROM THE WALL!!! A hideaway, Murphy bed!!! Not a Sweet Sleeper, at all. This was the best they could do!!!! Just then some kids banged on our door and ran off giggling!!! Oh, heck NO we are NOT staying here!!! To make a long story short… from the sucky room we call the Sheraton Downtown and after explaining to Jeff at the front desk what was going on, we were promptly treated like royalty. He told us to come on down… that he would set everything up… he gave us club level rooms at the same rate we had locked in online (the weekend rate was $200 a night we paid the original $119 a night) and free breakfast. Oh, the King sized Sweet Sleeper Bed was great… we never left the room. Thank you Sheraton Downtown Nashville. Oh, yeah, when we got home… we found a $2.97 charge on our American Express from… you guessed it, Sheraton Music City. They had told us there would be No charges!!! I’m disputing it… the saga continues!!!
I have stayed in better organised and efficiently run hotels in Serbia!!
reviews.title: This was awful

reviews.text: Our room smelt of vomit, the disabled access to the bar and lounge was blocked by a trolley and only grudgingly removed, twice!!
reviews.title: This is the best nights sleep at a hotel ever, its Sheraton for me from now on!
Lovely hotel - comfy beds!
reviews.text: Our Lunch order was fogotten and we were treated to a a member of staff complaing as to how busy they were and couldn't cope. Didn't look very busy to us.

To cap it all our breakfast order was totally forgotten forcing us to leave hungry. Areas of the lobby were taped off the folllowing morning resembling a crime scene perhaps the result of heavy partying.
reviews.title: Very Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Sheraton Music City last weekend, while we were visiting the city for a wedding. I had read all the tripadvisor comments and decided to choose this hotel (rated 3.5 stars on hotwire) over a 3-star hotel nearby. While our stay wasn't bad, it was not one which is usually commissurate with a 3-star hotel. I found the service to be lacking, specifically at the front desk--where the attendant mistakenly gave us the wrong keys for our room (even after the bellman asked her to check--because we had reserved 2 rooms), then hand wrote a room rate on the key packet that was $15 cheaper than what I'd actually paid. When asked about this rate, she stated "Oh--yes. That was the wrong rate. I'm not sure why I wrote that". Then when asked what the rate actually was...since I'd paid more...she stated "Oh--um--well, I actually don't know the rate." And when further pressed stated, "Whatever you paid is the correct rate. Yes, whatever you paid.". How is that response supposed to satisfy any customer who is interested in making sure that they paid the best possible rate?? It didn't. So, rather than pursue it, I decided to attempt to enjoy my stay. Upon arrival to the room, I found it to be quite average--not in keeping with it's 3.5 star rating. The bathroom was small--one cannot sit on the toilet and close the door to the bathroom at the same time. The beds were fairly comfortable, but nothing like the "dream-sleeper" that I was expecting. The best thing about the room was the showerhead --which provided a great stream of very hot water and the shower-rod which was the curvilinear-type, allowing for a more spacious feel in the shower. On the first morning, we decided to order breakfast by room service---until we were told that it would take anywhere from 50minutes to an hour to receive the food. That's just unheard of in a so-called upscale establishment. We decided to eat elsewhere. I must say that overall, it's not a bad place. The decor and furnishings were comfortable (about one step away from upsscale), and the place was clean (which is always a plus) , but they could improve upon the knowledge-base and timeliness of their customer service.
reviews.title: OK overall, Shower was the Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to the hotel website and got a summer special rate of $95 (plus Nashville's outrageous sales tax and lodging taxes, for a total of ~$109 per night).
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel In Nashville

reviews.text: The hotel is excellent. Beautiful lobby, with restaurant, lounge, coffee shop and meeting rooms. I was just there for a couple of nights on a leisure stay, so I didn't experience much of that.
reviews.title: Great place to stay
Glad I didn't pay more
reviews.text: Room was excellent with very comfortable bed and good bathroom.
Only dings I would give the hotel:
reviews.title: Not Bad at All

reviews.text: The grounds here are what made me want to stay here, rather than downtown. It's pretty, elegant, but not stuffy.
reviews.title: After room change- pretty good!
Great new Years Eve Stay
reviews.text: The rooms are newly renovated, large, but beware of room 2099. When we checked in late Friday night for the weekend, we were assigned this room, which has an adjoining door to the club level lounger (Duh! who planned that one out?)was VERY noisy and had a sorry excuse for a balcony oevrlooking the hotel's venilation system. There are some rooms with VERY bad views, make sure you request a courtyard view.

After we complained the next morning at about 9 am, we were not assigned a new room till 3 pm, so we had to wait around a bit, but it wasn't too bad. The new room was MUCH nicer! The hotel staff was accomodating, but not too overly concerned with our displeasure!
reviews.title: Plush, comfortable beds -- good value

reviews.text: We never ate here because the prices were outrageous. $14 for a breakfast- yeah right! But they do brew Starbucks =)And waffle house is down the street!
reviews.title: Pretty - oh so pretty!

reviews.text: It's a close, picturesque drive to Opryland - which is a nice tourist attraction, but fun nonetheless.
reviews.title: Very nice rooms but this is a BIG hotel
